intro: Eriogonum tenellum, commonly known as the common buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Eriogonum tenellum is an important early-season nectar source for bees and other pollinators.
